intro: Campylocentrum densiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered campylocentrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest blooms.
